Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is:

C. To define the project's approach to baselining products

Explanation:
The Change Theme in PRINCE2 (Projects IN Controlled Environments) is about managing changes to the project’s baseline products and ensuring that any changes are controlled. A minimum requirement of the Change Theme is to define how products will be baselined, as this establishes a foundation for managing changes.

Key points:

Baselining involves creating a reference point for products so any changes can be tracked against the original version.
Without baselining, it would be impossible to assess the impact of proposed changes.

C: Baseline for Control: A baseline is a snapshot of a product or set of products at a specific point in time. It acts as an agreed-upon reference point. Defining how baselines are created and managed is crucial for controlling change. Without a baseline, it's impossible to assess the impact of a proposed change or to track deviation

The correct answer is D. This process is a "handshake" between PM and TM. It consists of three stages: you agree with a work package, you execute it, you deliver it. There is nothing about project board.

https://prince2.wiki/processes/managing-product-delivery/
Managing Product Delivery Activities

Accepting a Work Package: The Team Manager accepts the Work Package from the Project Manager and creates the Team Plan to manage the development of the products.
Executing a Work Package: The team produces the products, requests the quality checks, obtains approval, and reports to the Project Manager using the Checkpoint Report.
Delivering a Work Package: Delivering a Work Package is delivering proof that the products are complete.
This involves ensuring that the Quality Register is updated, that approvals are done, that products are delivered as described in the Change Control Approach , and that the Project Manager is notified.

questions.question_text: According to the 'tailor to suit the project' principle, what is the basis for effective project management?
Which PRINCE2 principle is being applied when tolerances are set to establish limits of authority and accountability?

discussion.content:
C is correct because you are applying the principle of managing by exception, not a activity. 

Manage by exception: a project defines tolerances for each objective. PRINCE2 lists
six tolerances that can be set: time, cost, quality, scope, risk, and benefit. An issue
outside an agreed tolerance is called an ‘exception’. When an exception occurs, the
project manager sends an exception report to the project board who decide what to
do.
